The 'Valencian Community' (, ; ; ; also known in Valencian as PaÃ­s
ValenciÃ ){{efn|See bibliography and main references that uses the term
"Comunitat Valenciana ("Valencian Country", "Land of Valencia" or "Region of
Valencia"): *Names of the Valencian Community#References and external links
**Catalan Wikipedia (ViquipÃ¨dia): [[:ca:Denominacions de la Comunitat
Valenciana#ReferÃ¨ncies i Bibliografia|Denominacions de la Comunitat Valenciana]]
**Spanish Wikipedia: [[:es:Denominaciones de la Comunidad
Valenciana#BibliografÃ­a|Denominaciones de la Comunidad Valenciana]]}} [http://www.enciclopedia.cat/enciclop%C3%A8dies/gran-
enciclop%C3%A8dia-catalana/EC-GEC-
0048340.xml?s.q=Pa%C3%ADs+Valenci%C3%A0#.UXDCOaKppI4 La Comunitat Valenciana].
[[Gran EnciclopÃ¨dia Catalana]] (The Great Catalan Encyclopedia). is an
autonomous community of Spain located in central and south-eastern Iberian
Peninsula. Its capital and largest city is Valencia. The region is divided into
three provinces: Alacant, CastellÃ³ and ValÃ¨ncia, and thirty four [[Comarques of
the Valencian Community|comarques]].

It has 518 km of Mediterranean coastline and covers 23,259 kmÂ² of land
with 5.1 million inhabitants (2009). Its borders largely reflect those of
the historic Kingdom of Valencia.

The current version of the Valencian Statute of Autonomy (2006) declares the
Valencian Community [[Nationalities and regions of Spain|nationality]] of Spain.
The official languages are Valencian (as Catalan is known in this territory) Art. 6.2 of the
[http://www.cortsvalencianes.es/descarga/destacados/ESTATUT.pdf Valencian
Statute of Autonomy] Art. 6.2 of the, by effect of Art. 7 from [http://www.boe.es/boe_catalan/dias/2006-04-17/pdfs/A01104-
01124.pdf Organical Law 1/2006, April 10th] and Spanish.
